key_insight: Large-scale, automated synthesis of open-ended forecasting questions from daily news enables training language models (Qwen3) to reason about uncertain futures while avoiding evaluation leakage.
problem_solved: Addresses the lack of scalable, curated training/evaluation data for open-ended forecasting and the risk of future-data leakage when training and testing models on temporal information.
method: Automatically synthesize diverse forecasting questions from global daily news using a careful curation recipe to scale data generation.
Assemble the OpenForesight dataset and train Qwen3 'thinking' models on these forecasting tasks.
Prevent leakage by time-locking data (e.g., using offline/news-snapshot splits) during training and evaluation to ensure predictions are genuinely forward-looking.
impact: Provides practitioners a scalable benchmark and training dataset for building and evaluating models that reason about future uncertainty, improving robustness and trustworthiness for high-stakes forecasting.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: News articles → automated question synthesis → OpenForesight dataset → Qwen3 training → time-locked evaluation
Example prompt + model response card showing an open-ended forecasting question and a probabilistic/qualitative answer
Bar/line chart comparing model calibration/accuracy with and without time-locking (leakage prevention)
Icon set: globe (global news), gears (automation), shield (leakage protection), crystal ball (forecasting)
paper_title: Scaling Open-Ended Reasoning to Predict the Future
paper_authors: Nikhil Chandak, Shashwat Goel, Ameya Prabhu, Moritz Hardt, Jonas Geiping
